content: In setting up my laptop I decided to give Visual Studio Code a try. I was skeptical but have been really impressed -- built in Github commits and pushes, easy extensions to add on, etc.

On my main computer (Mac) I've been using Coda 2 for years. I've never found one that I really like on my laptop (Windows/Linux dual boot) but have tested a few over time, like PHP Storm, Atom, and Netbeans.
I have been considering upgrading Coda to the newer Nova, but now I may try VSC there too and keep things the same in both places.
